statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Lipscomb 72, Northern Colorado 60
article.story: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) -- Guards Brian Fisk and James Poindexter scored 15 points each as Lipscomb beat Northern Colorado 72-60 on Sunday night in a first-round Guardians Classic game at Rupp Arena. Eddie Ard added 14 points for Lipscomb (1-0), which advanced to play Kentucky (1-0), a 71-54 winner over South Dakota State, in the second round on Monday. Northern Colorado (0-1) will play South Dakota State (0-1) in a consolation game Monday. Lipscomb never trailed, jumping to a 7-0 lead as Northern Colorado missed its first five shots. The Bisons' lead peaked at 15 points twice, the latter at 37-22 on an Ard putback 2:13 before halftime. Lipscomb, which shot 56.7 percent in the first half, led 39-28 at the break. The Bears whittled the lead to 45-40 with 13:19 left, but Lipscomb scored eight of the next 11 points to rebuild its advantage to 10 points. Northern Colorado came no closer than seven points in the final 11 minutes. Cameron Robinson scored 13 points and Shaun Durant added 11 for the Bisons. Sean Taibi led Northern Colorado with 20 points, including 4-of-5 from 3-point range, while Kirk Archibeque, the Bears' leading scorer and rebounder last season, had 16 points and 10 rebounds. The Bears committed 20 turnovers and shot 37.5 percent from the field. "If you hold somebody to 37 percent from the floor you can win a lot of games," Lipscomb coach Scott Sanderson said. Lipscomb, a member of the Atlantic Sun Conference, finished 16-12 last season. The former NAIA basketball power, located in Nashville, Tenn., moved into Division I to start the 1999-2000 season. Northern Colorado is entering its third season as a Division I member after finishing 8-21 last season and 6-22 the season before that. The Bears will enter the Big Sky Conference for the 2006-07 season.
